alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kittson; Norman; Roseau; West Marshall; West Polk; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 31 at 3:32PM CST until February 01 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...A period of snow expected this evening, possibly mixed with freezing rain or sleet. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. After midnight look for strong west to northwest winds gusting over 50 mph creating reduced visibilities in blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...The severity of winter impacts is dependent on new snowfall or the crust on the snowpack breaking. At least some blowing snow and reduced visibilities in open country is expected, with a 30 percent chance for widespread blizzard conditions to develop.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Kittson; Norman; Roseau; West Marshall; West Polk; Wilkin
